attributes.action: Stop issuing parking tickets to parents dropping their children to school
attributes.additional_details:
There needs to be a stop to this form of collecting PCNs, we should be able to drop our kids & pick them up without having to worry about getting a ticket.
Where my son goes to school is residents parking only, there is no where for us working parents to park or drop them off which is outrageous.
There should be a time slot for us to pick/drop off our children during the school rush times.
I'm sick of having to pay £65, there is no other way for me to drop of my son & make it to work on time.
attributes.background:
I am a working mother with two children, one going to primary school which starts every morning at 8.55am and finishing at 3.15pm.
 The council have been sending a car with a camera to collect parking tickets from the parents and guardians dropping off their children to and from school.

rejection.details:
We can't accept your petition because the UK Government and Parliament aren't responsible for the issue you raise. Local parking is the responsibility of your local council.

You could raise your issue with a local councillor, who represents you. You can use this page to find out who your local councillors are, and how to contact them:

https://www.gov.uk/find-your-local-councillors
